Posts.Content: pf1968 wrote: Wow am I thrilled to have found this site.  Answered some questions so far, and I feel super educated.  HOWEVER - have a few left.  I went in for a mammogram at 40 - early 2009.  I had two masses one larger than the other.  Had a biopsy on the larger one and it was diagnosed as a fibroadenoma.  Watched it for a year and a half with no growth.  Waited from January 2010 to January 2011 (I was SUPPOSED to have a mammo on 7/2010 but missed it) - and there has been growth and change to the shape of the larger one.  It has grown to 2cm.  Unfortunately, since I was expecting it to be fine - I didn't pay attention to the BS at my first appointment this year, so don't know what it was before to know percentage of growth.  At one appointment - he did say "lobulation" when discussing the change in shape.  The radiologist report came back with very few details - "enlarging circumscribed mass left breast - no calcifications are identified - ACR BI-RADS category 4 (suspicious abnormality)."  I go back and forth from thinking it's nothing to thinking it could be something.  My concerns are - 1). since it was already diagnosed as a fibroadenoma, why would the radiologist then classify is as a "4"?  2). Is it common for fibroadenomas to change to lobulations?  If it were lobulated, wouldn't the radiologist have reflected that?  3). Can it be "circumbscribed" AND lobulated? 4). Is there a difference between "well circumbscribed" and "circumbscribed"?  I am generally not an alarmist, but I have to admit, this one has thrown me for a loop!  As an FYI - I am 43 with bilateral retromuscular breast implants.  I do have an excisional biopsy planned for 3/14, as my BS suggested it needs to come out.  One thing - in the earlier days of this (going on two weeks) - I started to take him serious and asked him if I should panic.  He suggested I not panic but be concerned.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fibroadenoma questions pf1968 Sommer43

Posts.Content: pf1968 wrote: I had an excisional biopsy for a birad rated 4 lump - previously diagnosed as a fibroadenoma two years ago.  It had changed in shape and size - so my BS decided it was time to come out.  When the procedure was over - the BS told me he would call me with the results (or have his staff do it).  He has a major poker face, but when pressed told me the tumor LOOKED like a fibroadenoma.  So I quit worrying (or so I thought) and went about healing and getting back to life.  The procedure was last Wednesday (today is Tuesday).  I have not heard from the doctor, and every time I call the office - the office staff tells me the results are not in.  It seems everything I read on here - folks get their results way before this.  How long is the norm? My concern now is that, rather than telling me on the phone, he would rather tell me the results at my Thursday a.m. check-up for the incision.  Paranoia will destroy ya........  Also - the procedure was super easy.  I was called in a few hours early - so no time in the a.m. to stress. I got a little hit of versed - and was given a little more, as well as a sedative and local.  I woke up hurting a little bit, and had pain off and on for two days.  I did take vicodin for those two days - but quit on the third day.  The pain was NOT bad, just enough to make me grumpy. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy - How long before results were in? pf1968 loriio
